Definition: or שְׂלָיו; by orthographical variation from {{h7951}} through the idea of sluggishness; the quail collectively (as slow in flight from its weight); quails.
from {{h7951}}; security; prosperity.
the same as {{h7596}} (shortened); request; Shelah, the name of a postdiluvian patriarch and of an Israelite; Shelah.
from the same as {{h3851}} with sibilant prefix; a flare of fire; (flaming) flame.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7951}}; to be secure; at rest.
(Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h7952}}; a wrong; thing amiss.
a primitive root (probably identical with {{h7953}} through the idea of educing); to mislead; deceive, be negligent.

a primitive root (rather cognate (by contraction) to the base of {{h5394}}, {{h7997}} and their congeners through the idea of extracting); to draw out or off, i.e. remove (the soul by death); take away.
from {{h7949}}; snow (probably from its whiteness); snow(-y).
or שָׁלַו; (Job 3:26), a primitive root; to be tranquil, i.e. secure or successful; be happy, prosper, be in safety.

or שָׁלֹשׁ; masculine שְׁלוֹשָׁה; or שְׁלֹשָׁה; a primitive number; three; occasionally (ordinal) third, or (multiple) thrice; fork,   often(-times), third, thir(-teen, -teenth), three,   thrice. Compare {{h7991}}.
probably for {{h7967}}; Shallun, an Israelite; Shallum.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7962}}; safety; tranquillity. See also {{h7961}}.
from {{h7951}}; security (genuine or false); abundance, peace(-ably), prosperity, quietness.
or שָׁלֵיו; feminine שְׁלֵוָה; from {{h7951}}; tranquil; (in a bad sense) careless; abstractly, security; (being) at ease, peaceable, (in) prosper(-ity), quiet(-ness), wealthy.
(Aramaic) or שָׁלוּת; (Aramaic), from the same as {{h7955}}; a fault; error, × fail, thing amiss.
or (shorter) שַׁלֻּם; the same as {{h7966}}; Shallum, the name of fourteen Israelites; Shallum.
or שִׁלֻּם; from {{h7999}}; a requital, i.e. (secure) retribution, (venal) a fee; recompense, reward.

or שָׁלֹם; from {{h7999}}; safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace; × do, familiar, × fare, favour,   friend, × great, (good) health, (× perfect, such as be at) peace(-able, -ably), prosper(-ity, -ous), rest, safe(-ty), salute, welfare, (× all is, be) well, × wholly.
or שִׁלֻּחַ; from {{h7971}}; (only in plural) a dismissal, i.e. (of a wife) divorce (especially the document); also (of a daughter) dower; presents, have sent back.
the same as {{h7973}}; Shelach, a postdiluvian patriarch; Salah, Shelah. Compare {{h7975}}.
or (in imitation of {{h7974}}) שֶׁלַח; (Nehemiah 3:15), from {{h7971}}; rill; Shiloach, a fountain of Jerusalem; Shiloah, Siloah.
feminine of {{h7964}}; a shoot; branch.
from {{h7973}}; missive, i.e. armed; Shilchi, an Israelite; Shilhi.
or שְׁלֹשִׁים; multiple of {{h7969}}; thirty; or (ordinal) thirtieth; thirty, thirtieth. Compare {{h7991}}.

a primitive root; to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications); × any wise, appoint, bring (on the way), cast (away, out), conduct, × earnestly, forsake, give (up), grow long, lay, leave, let depart (down, go, loose), push away, put (away, forth, in, out), reach forth, send (away, forth, out), set, shoot (forth, out), sow, spread, stretch forth (out).
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7971}}; put, send.
from {{h7971}}; a missile of attack, i.e. spear; also (figuratively) a shoot of growth; i.e. branch; dart, plant, × put off, sword, weapon.
plural of {{h7973}}; javelins or sprouts; Shilchim, a place in Palestine; Shilhim.
from {{h7971}}; a table (as spread out); by implication, a meal; table.

a primitive root; to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose); × at all, cast down, (lover-)lay (self) (down), (make to) lie (down, down to sleep, still with), lodge, ravish, take rest, sleep, stay.
from {{h7901}}; a (sexual) lying with; × lie.
from {{h7901}}; a lying down (of dew, or for the sexual act); × carnally, copulation, × lay, seed.
feminine of {{h7900}} in the sense of {{h7899}}; a dart (as pointed like a thorn); barbed iron.
a primitive root; to roam (through lust); in the morning (by mistake for {{h7925}}).
from the same as {{h7906}}; observant, i.e. (concretely) the mind; heart.
from an unused root apparently meaning to surmount; an observatory (with the article); Seku, a place in Palestine; Sechu.
or שַׁכֻּל; from {{h7921}}; bereaved; barren, bereaved (robbed) of children (whelps).
infinitive of {{h7921}}; bereavement; loss of children, spoiling.
from {{h7980}}; potent; concretely, a prince or warrior; governor, mighty, that hath power, ruler.
feminine from {{h7953}}; a fetus or babe (as extruded in birth); young one.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7980}}; have the mastery, have power, bear rule, be (make) ruler.
a primitive root; to dominate, i.e. govern; by implication, to permit; (bear, have) rule, have dominion, give (have) power.
from {{h7980}}; a potentate; power.
from {{h7980}}; probably a shield (as controlling, i.e. protecting the person); shield.
(Aramaic) from {{h7981}}; empire (abstractly or concretely); dominion.
(Aramaic) or שִׁלְטֹןlemma שִׁלְטן missing vowel, corrected to שִׁלְטֹן; corresponding to {{h7983}}; ruler.
from {{h7951}}; privacy; quietly.
feminine from {{h7980}}; a vixen; imperious.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7911}} through the idea of disclosure of a covered or forgotten thing; to discover (literally or figuratively); find.
from {{h7911}}; oblivious; forget.
or שִׁכֹּר; from {{h7937}}; intoxicated, as a state or a habit; drunk(-ard, -en, -en man).
or שָׁכֵחַ; a primitive root; to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention; × at all, (cause to) forget.
from {{h7936}}; a man at wages	by the day or year; hired (man, servant), hireling.
feminine of {{h7916}}; a hiring; that is hired.
feminine from the same as {{h7906}}; a conspicuous object; picture.
intensive perhaps from the same as {{h7906}} in the sense of {{h7753}}; a knife (as pointed or edged); knife.
a primitive root; to weave (i.e. lay) a trap; figuratively, (through the idea of secreting) to allay (passions; physically, abate a flood); appease, assuage, make to cease, pacify, set.

a primitive root; to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent; consider, expert, instruct, prosper, (deal) prudent(-ly), (give) skill(-ful), have good success, teach, (have, make to) understand(-ing), wisdom, (be, behave self, consider, make) wise(-ly), guide wittingly.
from {{h7997}}; booty; prey, spoil.

a primitive root; to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications); make amends, (make an) end, finish, full, give again, make good, (re-) pay (again), (make) (to) (be at) peace(-able), that is perfect, perform, (make) prosper(-ous), recompense, render, requite, make restitution, restore, reward, × surely.
ordinal from {{h7969}}; third; feminine a third (part); by extension, a third (day, year or time); specifically, a third-story cell); third (part, rank, time), three (years old).
a primitive root; to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively); adventure, cast (away, down, forth, off, out), hurl, pluck, throw.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7989}}; mighty; abstractly, permission; concretely, a premier; captain, be lawful, rule(-r).

or שָׁלוֹשׁ; (1 Chronicles 11:11; 1 Chronicles 12:18), or שָׁלֹשׁ; (2 Samuel 23:13), from {{h7969}}; a triple, i.e. (as a musical instrument) a triangle (or perhaps rather three-stringed lute); also (as an indefinite, great quantity) a three-fold measure (perhaps a treble ephah); also (as an officer) a general of the third rank (upward, i.e. the highest); captain, instrument of musick, (great) lord, (great) measure, prince, three (from the margin).
the same as {{h7995}}; Shalleketh, a gate in Jerusalem; Shalleketh.
a primitive root; to drop or strip; by implication, to plunder; let fall, make self a prey, × of purpose, (make a, (take)) spoil.
from {{h7993}}; bird of prey, usually thought to be the pelican (from casting itself into the sea); cormorant.
from {{h7993}}; a felling (of trees); when cast.
feminine of {{h7926}}; the shoulderbone; shoulder blade.
for {{h7926}}; Shekem, the name of a Hivite and two Israelites; Shechem.
the same as {{h7926}}; ridge; Shekem, a place in Palestine; Shechem.
from {{h7925}}; the neck (between the shoulders) as the place of burdens; figuratively, the spur of a hill; back, × consent, portion, shoulder.

a primitive root; properly, to incline (the shoulder to a burden); but used only as denominative from {{h7926}}; literally, to load up (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to start early in the morning; (arise, be up, get (oneself) up, rise up) early (betimes), morning.
(Aramaic) from {{h7920}}; intelligence; understanding.
plural from {{h7921}}; childlessness (by continued bereavements); to have after loss of others.
or שֵׂכֶל; from {{h7919}}; intelligence; by implication, success; discretion, knowledge, policy, prudence, sense, understanding, wisdom, wise.

a primitive root; properly, to miscarry, i.e. suffer abortion; by analogy, to bereave (literally or figuratively); bereave (of children), barren, cast calf (fruit, young), be (make) childless, deprive, destroy, × expect, lose children, miscarry, rob of children, spoil.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7919}}; consider.
from {{h7936}}; wages; reward, sluices.
from {{h7936}}; payment of contract; concretely, salary, fare, maintenance; by implication, compensation, benefit; hire, price, reward(-ed), wages, worth.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7999}}; to complete, to restore; deliver, finish.
patronymic from {{h7928}}; a Shikmite (collectively), or descendants of Shekem; Shichemites.

a primitive root (apparently akin (by transmission) to {{h7901}} through the idea of lodging; compare {{h5531}}, {{h7925}}); to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively); abide, continue, (cause to, make to) dwell(-er), have habitation, inhabit, lay, place, (cause to) remain, rest, set (up).
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7931}}; cause to dwell, have habitation.
from {{h7931}}; a residence; habitation.
from {{h7931}}; a resident; by extension, a fellow-citizen; inhabitant, neighbour, nigh.
or (prolonged) שְׁכַנְיָהוּ; from {{h7931}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has dwelt; Shekanjah, the name of nine Israelites; Shecaniah, Shechaniah.

or (by permutation) סָכַר; (Ezra 4:5), a primitive root (apparently akin (by prosthesis) to {{h3739}} through the idea of temporary purchase; compare {{h7937}}); to hire; earn wages, hire (out self), reward, × surely.

a primitive root; to become tipsy; in a qualified sense, to satiate with a stimulating drink or (figuratively) influence; (be filled with) drink (abundantly), (be, make) drunk(-en), be merry. (Superlative of {{h8248}}.)
a primitive root; properly, meaning to be white; used only as denominative from {{h7950}}; to be snow-white (with the linen clothing of the slain); be as snow.
from {{h7947}}; a spacer or raised interval, i.e. the stile in a frame or panel; ledge.
for the rel. {{h834}}; used with prepositional prefix, and often followed by some pronominal affix; on account of, whatsoever, whichsoever; cause, sake.
from {{h7952}} abbreviated form; a fault; error.
a primitive root; to space off; intensive (evenly) to make equi-distant; equally distant, set in order.
for {{h7600}}; tranquil; being at ease.
from {{h7937}}; an intoxicant, i.e. intensely alcoholic liquor; strong drink,   drunkard, strong wine.
the same as {{h7939}}; recompense; Sakar, the name of two Israelites; Sacar.
from {{h7937}}; intoxication; (be) drunken(-ness).
for {{h7943}}; drunkenness, Shikkeron, a place in Palestine; Shicron.
